newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil voluntary redundancy plan open to 320,000.
newsitem.headline: Brazil voluntary redundancy plan open to 320,000.

text.p: The Brazilian government on Tuesday unveiled a voluntary redundancy plan that could be taken up by nearly 320,000 of the 546,000 federal government workers, the Administration Ministry said.
The ministry said in a statement that the only federal workers not included in the voluntary redundancy program were those working in understaffed areas or areas considered of strategical priority.
Administration minister Luiz Carlos Bresser Pereira told reporters civil servants could apply to join the scheme from November 21 to December 18.
"We are doing this because we are convinced there is an excess of public sector workers," he said.
Bresser Pereira said there would be incentives for workers seeking voluntary redundancy.
Workers with up to 14 years' service would receive one extra monthly salary for every year worked, the statement said.
Workers with up to 24 years' service would receive one monthly salary for each of the first 14 years and one and a half monthly salaries for each of the rest, it added.
Workers with more than 24 years' service would receive 1.8 monthly salaries for every year above the 24 years.
